sentence.source: Nickel, Marilyn; Wilner, John. Papers on Sranan Tongo. n.d. Summer Institute of Linguistics. Example 2b
sentence.text: no lon!
sentence.gloss: don't run!

sentence.source: Nickel, Marilyn; Wilner, John. Papers on Sranan Tongo. n.d. Summer Institute of Linguistics. Example 2d
sentence.text: a boi sribi langa
sentence.gloss: the boy slept a long time

sentence.source: Nickel, Marilyn; Wilner, John. Papers on Sranan Tongo. n.d. Summer Institute of Linguistics. Example 2f
sentence.text: a doro wan pikin kampu
sentence.gloss: he came to a small hut

sentence.source: Nickel, Marilyn; Wilner, John. Papers on Sranan Tongo. n.d. Summer Institute of Linguistics. Example 2h
sentence.text: luku dya
sentence.gloss: look here

sentence.source: Nickel, Marilyn; Wilner, John. Papers on Sranan Tongo. n.d. Summer Institute of Linguistics. Example 3b
sentence.text: mi e teki wan pan
sentence.gloss: I take a pan

sentence.source: Nickel, Marilyn; Wilner, John. Papers on Sranan Tongo. n.d. Summer Institute of Linguistics. Example 3d
sentence.text: mi e poti en ini a patu
sentence.gloss: I put it in the pot

sentence.source: Nickel, Marilyn; Wilner, John. Papers on Sranan Tongo. n.d. Summer Institute of Linguistics. Example 3f
sentence.text: mi naki ete nanga wan tiki
sentence.gloss: I hit it again with the stick

sentence.source: Nickel, Marilyn; Wilner, John. Papers on Sranan Tongo. n.d. Summer Institute of Linguistics. Example 4a
sentence.text: yu kan leni mi wan moni?
sentence.gloss: can you lend me some money?

sentence.source: Nickel, Marilyn; Wilner, John. Papers on Sranan Tongo. n.d. Summer Institute of Linguistics. Example 4c
sentence.text: mi e go gi yu en baka
sentence.gloss: 'I'll give it back to you

sentence.source: Nickel, Marilyn; Wilner, John. Papers on Sranan Tongo. n.d. Summer Institute of Linguistics. Example 5a
sentence.text: na yu mi e kon
sentence.gloss: I'm coming to you

sentence.source: Nickel, Marilyn; Wilner, John. Papers on Sranan Tongo. n.d. Summer Institute of Linguistics. Example 5c
sentence.text: na moni mi abi fanowdu
sentence.gloss: I need money

sentence.source: Nickel, Marilyn; Wilner, John. Papers on Sranan Tongo. n.d. Summer Institute of Linguistics. Example 7a
sentence.text: Anansi no kan go moro na Kakalaka
sentence.gloss: Anansi can't go to Cockroach anymore

sentence.source: Nickel, Marilyn; Wilner, John. Papers on Sranan Tongo. n.d. Summer Institute of Linguistics. Example 8
sentence.text: yu kan go na wowoyo gi mi
sentence.gloss: can you go to the market for me?

sentence.source: Nickel, Marilyn; Wilner, John. Papers on Sranan Tongo. n.d. Summer Institute of Linguistics. Example 9b
sentence.text: Sanede yu du dati?
sentence.gloss: Why did you do that?

sentence.source: Nickel, Marilyn; Wilner, John. Papers on Sranan Tongo. n.d. Summer Institute of Linguistics. Example 10a
sentence.text: tek' no?
sentence.gloss: Would you like some?

sentence.source: Nickel, Marilyn; Wilner, John. Papers on Sranan Tongo. n.d. Summer Institute of Linguistics. Example 10c
sentence.text: y' e kon tamara?
sentence.gloss: Are you coming tomorrow?

sentence.source: Nickel, Marilyn; Wilner, John. Papers on Sranan Tongo. n.d. Summer Institute of Linguistics. Example 11b
sentence.text: Bai tu paki brede gi mi!
sentence.gloss: Buy two packs of bread for me!

sentence.source: Nickel, Marilyn; Wilner, John. Papers on Sranan Tongo. n.d. Summer Institute of Linguistics. Example 12a
sentence.text: a doti
sentence.gloss: it's dirty

sentence.source: Nickel, Marilyn; Wilner, John. Papers on Sranan Tongo. n.d. Summer Institute of Linguistics. Example 12c
sentence.text: mi frow e siki
sentence.gloss: my wife is sick

sentence.source: Nickel, Marilyn; Wilner, John. Papers on Sranan Tongo. n.d. Summer Institute of Linguistics. Example 13b
sentence.text: Anansi no ben de tefreide
sentence.gloss: Anansi was not satisfied

sentence.source: Nickel, Marilyn; Wilner, John. Papers on Sranan Tongo. n.d. Summer Institute of Linguistics. Example 13d
sentence.text: a kamra pe den ben e tan ben dungru
sentence.gloss: the room where they stayed was dark

sentence.source: Nickel, Marilyn; Wilner, John. Papers on Sranan Tongo. n.d. Summer Institute of Linguistics. Example 14b
sentence.text: a e dungru kba
sentence.gloss: it's getting dark already

sentence.source: Nickel, Marilyn; Wilner, John. Papers on Sranan Tongo. n.d. Summer Institute of Linguistics. Example 15b
sentence.text: den prakseri taki den bun moro Gado
sentence.gloss: they think that they are better than God

sentence.source: Nickel, Marilyn; Wilner, John. Papers on Sranan Tongo. n.d. Summer Institute of Linguistics. Example 16a
sentence.text: dotdoti no de inisei
sentence.gloss: there isn't any dirt inside

sentence.source: Nickel, Marilyn; Wilner, John. Papers on Sranan Tongo. n.d. Summer Institute of Linguistics. Example 16c
sentence.text: merki no de srefsrefi a foto
sentence.gloss: there isn't any milk at all in town

sentence.source: Nickel, Marilyn; Wilner, John. Papers on Sranan Tongo. n.d. Summer Institute of Linguistics. Example 17b
sentence.text: dati na a triki fu en
sentence.gloss: that is his trick

sentence.source: Nickel, Marilyn; Wilner, John. Papers on Sranan Tongo. n.d. Summer Institute of Linguistics. Example 17d
sentence.text: a basi fu a basya dati ben de wan bakra ofisiri
sentence.gloss: the boss of that overseer was a Dutch officer

sentence.source: Nickel, Marilyn; Wilner, John. Papers on Sranan Tongo. n.d. Summer Institute of Linguistics. Example 18b
sentence.text: en a no mi mati
sentence.gloss: he is not my friend

sentence.source: Nickel, Marilyn; Wilner, John. Papers on Sranan Tongo. n.d. Summer Institute of Linguistics. Example 19b
sentence.text: den tu sma disi a no Sranansma
sentence.gloss: these two people are not Surinamers

sentence.source: Nickel, Marilyn; Wilner, John. Papers on Sranan Tongo. n.d. Summer Institute of Linguistics. Example 21
sentence.text: I mama nanga i papa e go na kerki, dan a e tyari yu go.
sentence.gloss: Your mother and father take you to church.

sentence.source: Nickel, Marilyn; Wilner, John. Papers on Sranan Tongo. n.d. Summer Institute of Linguistics. Example 22b
sentence.text: a konkoni no ben de fu Ontiman
sentence.gloss: the rabbit was not Hunter's

sentence.source: Nickel, Marilyn; Wilner, John. Papers on Sranan Tongo. n.d. Summer Institute of Linguistics. Example 23a
sentence.text: a kon mangri
sentence.gloss: he's gotten skinny

sentence.source: Nickel, Marilyn; Wilner, John. Papers on Sranan Tongo. n.d. Summer Institute of Linguistics. Example 24a
sentence.text: a e fatu
sentence.gloss: he's getting fat

sentence.source: Nickel, Marilyn; Wilner, John. Papers on Sranan Tongo. n.d. Summer Institute of Linguistics. Example 24c
sentence.text: a kon fatu
sentence.gloss: he's gotten fat

sentence.source: Nickel, Marilyn; Wilner, John. Papers on Sranan Tongo. n.d. Summer Institute of Linguistics. Example 25b
sentence.text: wan ben tron datra srefi
sentence.gloss: one person even became a doctor

sentence.source: Nickel, Marilyn; Wilner, John. Papers on Sranan Tongo. n.d. Summer Institute of Linguistics. Example 26a
sentence.text: a ben o tyari en gi wan sma di_ ben bestel en
sentence.gloss: he would take it to someone who ordered it

sentence.source: Nickel, Marilyn; Wilner, John. Papers on Sranan Tongo. n.d. Summer Institute of Linguistics. Example 26c
sentence.text: a fasi fa den ben e libi nanga den no ben de bun srefsrefi
sentence.gloss: the manner in which they lived with them was not good at all!

sentence.source: Nickel, Marilyn; Wilner, John. Papers on Sranan Tongo. n.d. Summer Institute of Linguistics. Example 27a
sentence.text: a pikin èn a grun
sentence.gloss: it's small and it's green

sentence.source: Nickel, Marilyn; Wilner, John. Papers on Sranan Tongo. n.d. Summer Institute of Linguistics. Example 27c
sentence.text: want son leisi a aleisi e krin ma son leisi a e doti
sentence.gloss: because sometimes the rice is clean but sometimes it's dirty

sentence.source: Nickel, Marilyn; Wilner, John. Papers on Sranan Tongo. n.d. Summer Institute of Linguistics. Example 28a
sentence.text: a e bukun ini a peti fu teki a watra
sentence.gloss: he stooped in the well to draw the water

sentence.source: Nickel, Marilyn; Wilner, John. Papers on Sranan Tongo. n.d. Summer Institute of Linguistics. Example 29
sentence.text: mi kan kisi wan pisi fu a konkoni bori pikin supu
sentence.gloss: can I get a piece of the rabbit to cook a little soup?

sentence.source: Nickel, Marilyn; Wilner, John. Papers on Sranan Tongo. n.d. Summer Institute of Linguistics. Example 30b
sentence.text: ingrisman nanga spanyoroman ben e feti fu teki Sranan bika Sranan ben abi furu gowtu
sentence.gloss: England and Spain fought to take Suriname because Suriname had a lot of gold

sentence.source: Nickel, Marilyn; Wilner, John. Papers on Sranan Tongo. n.d. Summer Institute of Linguistics. Example 31
sentence.text: Efu a no doti mi no e wasi en furu. Ma efu a doti dan mi e wasi en wasi en moi
sentence.gloss: if it isn't dirty I don't wash it much, but if it's dirty then I wash it well

sentence.source: Nickel, Marilyn; Wilner, John. Papers on Sranan Tongo. n.d. Summer Institute of Linguistics. Example 33a
sentence.text: te mi firi lesi dan mi no e teki wan pan
sentence.gloss: when I feel lazy then I don't take a pan

sentence.source: Nickel, Marilyn; Wilner, John. Papers on Sranan Tongo. n.d. Summer Institute of Linguistics. Example 33c
sentence.text: a e prakseri wan sani fosi a du en
sentence.gloss: he thinks about something before he does it

sentence.source: Nickel, Marilyn; Wilner, John. Papers on Sranan Tongo. n.d. Summer Institute of Linguistics. Example 34a
sentence.text: un libi en meki a waka
sentence.gloss: leave it alone, let it walk about

sentence.source: Nickel, Marilyn; Wilner, John. Papers on Sranan Tongo. n.d. Summer Institute of Linguistics. Example 35a
sentence.text: mi meki a wasi
sentence.gloss: I made him wash

sentence.source: Nickel, Marilyn; Wilner, John. Papers on Sranan Tongo. n.d. Summer Institute of Linguistics. Example 36
sentence.text: den srafumasra ben e si den leki fa yu e si wan meti
sentence.gloss: the slave masters saw them as animals

sentence.source: Nickel, Marilyn; Wilner, John. Papers on Sranan Tongo. n.d. Summer Institute of Linguistics. Example 38a
sentence.text: Anansi prakseri taki: man, na moni mi abi fanowdu.
sentence.gloss: Anansi thought, 'Man, I need money.'

sentence.source: Nickel, Marilyn; Wilner, John. Papers on Sranan Tongo. n.d. Summer Institute of Linguistics. Example 38c
sentence.text: ala sma sabi taki Anansi abi tumsi furu triki
sentence.gloss: everyone knows that Anansi has very many tricks

sentence.source: Nickel, Marilyn; Wilner, John. Papers on Sranan Tongo. n.d. Summer Institute of Linguistics. Example 39a
sentence.text: mi e aksi efu mi kan kisi wan pi si fu a konkoni
sentence.gloss: I'm asking if I can get a piece of the rabbit

sentence.source: Nickel, Marilyn; Wilner, John. Papers on Sranan Tongo. n.d. Summer Institute of Linguistics. Example 39c
sentence.text: a taki dat mi no man go
sentence.gloss: he said that I couldn't go

sentence.source: Nickel, Marilyn; Wilner, John. Papers on Sranan Tongo. n.d. Summer Institute of Linguistics. Example 40b
sentence.text: a no sabi pe den boi kibri
sentence.gloss: he didn't know where the boys were hiding

sentence.source: Nickel, Marilyn; Wilner, John. Papers on Sranan Tongo. n.d. Summer Institute of Linguistics. Example 41b
sentence.text: kon nyan nanga mi
sentence.gloss: come and eat with me

sentence.source: Nickel, Marilyn; Wilner, John. Papers on Sranan Tongo. n.d. Summer Institute of Linguistics. Example 41d
sentence.text: mi e go teki a pikin boi tyari en kon dya
sentence.gloss: I'm going to get that little boy and bring him here

sentence.source: Nickel, Marilyn; Wilner, John. Papers on Sranan Tongo. n.d. Summer Institute of Linguistics. Example 41f
sentence.text: a si don kibri mindri den kronto wiwiri
sentence.gloss: he sat down and hid among the coconut fronds

sentence.source: Nickel, Marilyn; Wilner, John. Papers on Sranan Tongo. n.d. Summer Institute of Linguistics. Example 42b
sentence.text: mi e puru en kon na dorosei
sentence.gloss: I take it out

sentence.source: Nickel, Marilyn; Wilner, John. Papers on Sranan Tongo. n.d. Summer Institute of Linguistics. Example 42d
sentence.text: den man seni teki srafu kmopo na Afrika kondre
sentence.gloss: the men sent for slaves from Africa

sentence.source: Nickel, Marilyn; Wilner, John. Papers on Sranan Tongo. n.d. Summer Institute of Linguistics. Example 43a
sentence.text: a kamra
sentence.gloss: the room

sentence.source: Nickel, Marilyn; Wilner, John. Papers on Sranan Tongo. n.d. Summer Institute of Linguistics. Example 43c
sentence.text: mi mati
sentence.gloss: my friend

sentence.source: Nickel, Marilyn; Wilner, John. Papers on Sranan Tongo. n.d. Summer Institute of Linguistics. Example 44a
sentence.text: den seibi lowe srafu
sentence.gloss: the seven runaway slaves

sentence.source: Nickel, Marilyn; Wilner, John. Papers on Sranan Tongo. n.d. Summer Institute of Linguistics. Example 44c
sentence.text: ala tu go na skoro
sentence.gloss: both went to school

sentence.source: Nickel, Marilyn; Wilner, John. Papers on Sranan Tongo. n.d. Summer Institute of Linguistics. Example 46a
sentence.text: a di fu fo boi nen Robin
sentence.gloss: the fourth boy is named Robin

sentence.source: Nickel, Marilyn; Wilner, John. Papers on Sranan Tongo. n.d. Summer Institute of Linguistics. Example 46c
sentence.text: Anansi abi tumsi furu triki
sentence.gloss: Anansi has very many tricks

sentence.source: Nickel, Marilyn; Wilner, John. Papers on Sranan Tongo. n.d. Summer Institute of Linguistics. Example 47b
sentence.text: soso dungru katun krosi
sentence.gloss: only dark cotton clothes

sentence.source: Nickel, Marilyn; Wilner, John. Papers on Sranan Tongo. n.d. Summer Institute of Linguistics. Example 48b
sentence.text: mi masra famiri oso: general structure
sentence.gloss: my husband's family's house

sentence.source: Nickel, Marilyn; Wilner, John. Papers on Sranan Tongo. n.d. Summer Institute of Linguistics. Example 49b
sentence.text: Ontiman lon gwe
sentence.gloss: Hunter ran away

sentence.source: Nickel, Marilyn; Wilner, John. Papers on Sranan Tongo. n.d. Summer Institute of Linguistics. Example 49d
sentence.text: someni sortu tra wroko
sentence.gloss: so many other kinds of work

sentence.source: Nickel, Marilyn; Wilner, John. Papers on Sranan Tongo. n.d. Summer Institute of Linguistics. Example 49f
sentence.text: ma furu fu den dati no ben de
sentence.gloss: but there weren't many of those

sentence.source: Nickel, Marilyn; Wilner, John. Papers on Sranan Tongo. n.d. Summer Institute of Linguistics. Example 50b
sentence.text: ala tu go na skoro
sentence.gloss: both (of them) went to school

sentence.source: Nickel, Marilyn; Wilner, John. Papers on Sranan Tongo. n.d. Summer Institute of Linguistics. Example 51b
sentence.text: den sani disi
sentence.gloss: these things

sentence.source: Nickel, Marilyn; Wilner, John. Papers on Sranan Tongo. n.d. Summer Institute of Linguistics. Example 53a
sentence.text: a kamra pe den ben e tan
sentence.gloss: the room where they stayed

sentence.source: Nickel, Marilyn; Wilner, John. Papers on Sranan Tongo. n.d. Summer Institute of Linguistics. Example 53c
sentence.text: wan tori fu Anansi
sentence.gloss: a story about Anansi

sentence.source: Nickel, Marilyn; Wilner, John. Papers on Sranan Tongo. n.d. Summer Institute of Linguistics. Example 53e
sentence.text: srafuten na ini Sranan
sentence.gloss: the time of slavery in Suriname

sentence.source: Nickel, Marilyn; Wilner, John. Papers on Sranan Tongo. n.d. Summer Institute of Linguistics. Example 55a
sentence.text: a fosi wan a ben leisi kba
sentence.gloss: the first one he's read already

sentence.source: Nickel, Marilyn; Wilner, John. Papers on Sranan Tongo. n.d. Summer Institute of Linguistics. Example 55c
sentence.text: a nen fu a di fu dri mi e fergiti
sentence.gloss: the name of the third one I forget

sentence.source: Nickel, Marilyn; Wilner, John. Papers on Sranan Tongo. n.d. Summer Institute of Linguistics. Example 56b
sentence.text: mi ben bai wan anu lepi bakba
sentence.gloss: I bought one bunch of ripe bananas

sentence.source: Nickel, Marilyn; Wilner, John. Papers on Sranan Tongo. n.d. Summer Institute of Linguistics. Example 57a
sentence.text: a moro bigi wan
sentence.gloss: the biggest one

sentence.source: Nickel, Marilyn; Wilner, John. Papers on Sranan Tongo. n.d. Summer Institute of Linguistics. Example 58a
sentence.text: a pikin boi fu mi
sentence.gloss: my little boy

sentence.source: Nickel, Marilyn; Wilner, John. Papers on Sranan Tongo. n.d. Summer Institute of Linguistics. Example 59a
sentence.text: yu umapikin
sentence.gloss: your daughter

sentence.source: Nickel, Marilyn; Wilner, John. Papers on Sranan Tongo. n.d. Summer Institute of Linguistics. Example 59c
sentence.text: mi ma prasoro
sentence.gloss: my mother's umbrella

sentence.source: Nickel, Marilyn; Wilner, John. Papers on Sranan Tongo. n.d. Summer Institute of Linguistics. Example 60b
sentence.text: en triki
sentence.gloss: his trick

sentence.source: Nickel, Marilyn; Wilner, John. Papers on Sranan Tongo. n.d. Summer Institute of Linguistics. Example 61
sentence.text: Anansi sabi fa a e psa en dei
sentence.gloss: Anansi knows how to spend his day

sentence.source: Nickel, Marilyn; Wilner, John. Papers on Sranan Tongo. n.d. Summer Institute of Linguistics. Example 62b
sentence.text: den ben mus tyari dati gi den misi nanga den masra
sentence.gloss: they had to take that to their mistress and master

sentence.source: Nickel, Marilyn; Wilner, John. Papers on Sranan Tongo. n.d. Summer Institute of Linguistics. Example 63b
sentence.text: en nanga trawan kon dya nanga wan bigi sipi
sentence.gloss: he and others came here on a big ship

sentence.source: Nickel, Marilyn; Wilner, John. Papers on Sranan Tongo. n.d. Summer Institute of Linguistics. Example 64a
sentence.text: mi abi wan broin nanga blaka dagu
sentence.gloss: I have a brown and black dog

sentence.source: Nickel, Marilyn; Wilner, John. Papers on Sranan Tongo. n.d. Summer Institute of Linguistics. Example 65a
sentence.text: en nanga trawan kon dya nanga wan bigi sipi
sentence.gloss: he and others came here on a big ship

sentence.source: Nickel, Marilyn; Wilner, John. Papers on Sranan Tongo. n.d. Summer Institute of Linguistics. Example 66
sentence.text: bori pikin supu gi ma Akuba nanga pikin anansi
sentence.gloss: cook a little soup for Akuba and the child

sentence.source: Nickel, Marilyn; Wilner, John. Papers on Sranan Tongo. n.d. Summer Institute of Linguistics. Example 68
sentence.text: mi ben go nanga wantu mati fu mi
sentence.gloss: 1 went with some friends of mine

sentence.source: Nickel, Marilyn; Wilner, John. Papers on Sranan Tongo. n.d. Summer Institute of Linguistics. Example 70
sentence.text: na en ben feni Sranan ini a yari fu 1492
sentence.gloss: he found Suriname in the year 1492

sentence.source: Nickel, Marilyn; Wilner, John. Papers on Sranan Tongo. n.d. Summer Institute of Linguistics. Example 71b
sentence.text: kren go na tapu a kronto bon
sentence.gloss: climb to the top of the coconut tree

sentence.source: Nickel, Marilyn; Wilner, John. Papers on Sranan Tongo. n.d. Summer Institute of Linguistics. Example 71d
sentence.text: na yu mi e kon
sentence.gloss: I've come to you

sentence.source: Nickel, Marilyn; Wilner, John. Papers on Sranan Tongo. n.d. Summer Institute of Linguistics. Example 72a
sentence.text: yu mus bribi na Gado tapu
sentence.gloss: you must believe in God

sentence.source: Nickel, Marilyn; Wilner, John. Papers on Sranan Tongo. n.d. Summer Institute of Linguistics. Example 73a
sentence.text: Anansi ben prei wan triki nanga Kakalaka nanga Kafowru
sentence.gloss: Anansi played a trick on Cockroach and Chicken

sentence.source: Nickel, Marilyn; Wilner, John. Papers on Sranan Tongo. n.d. Summer Institute of Linguistics. Example 73c
sentence.text: mi e go na wowoyo
sentence.gloss: I'm going to the market

sentence.source: Nickel, Marilyn; Wilner, John. Papers on Sranan Tongo. n.d. Summer Institute of Linguistics. Example 73e
sentence.text: mi o ferteri wan pikin tori
sentence.gloss: I'm going to tell a short story

sentence.source: Nickel, Marilyn; Wilner, John. Papers on Sranan Tongo. n.d. Summer Institute of Linguistics. Example 73g
sentence.text: Anansi sabi taki a dei dati Tigri ben o kon tu
sentence.gloss: Anansi knew that that day Tiger would come too

sentence.source: Nickel, Marilyn; Wilner, John. Papers on Sranan Tongo. n.d. Summer Institute of Linguistics. Example 74b
sentence.text: mi o gwe.
sentence.gloss: I'm going to leave (soon)

sentence.source: Nickel, Marilyn; Wilner, John. Papers on Sranan Tongo. n.d. Summer Institute of Linguistics. Example 75a
sentence.text: mi no kan gi yu a konkoni
sentence.gloss: I can't give you the rabbit

sentence.source: Nickel, Marilyn; Wilner, John. Papers on Sranan Tongo. n.d. Summer Institute of Linguistics. Example 75c
sentence.text: den ben mag go na skoro
sentence.gloss: they were able to go to school

sentence.source: Nickel, Marilyn; Wilner, John. Papers on Sranan Tongo. n.d. Summer Institute of Linguistics. Example 76a
sentence.text: mi wani go bori aleisi
sentence.gloss: 1 want to cook rice now

sentence.source: Nickel, Marilyn; Wilner, John. Papers on Sranan Tongo. n.d. Summer Institute of Linguistics. Example 77a
sentence.text: a kba bori
sentence.gloss: it's finished cooking

sentence.source: Nickel, Marilyn; Wilner, John. Papers on Sranan Tongo. n.d. Summer Institute of Linguistics. Example 77c
sentence.text: mi kba wasi krosi
sentence.gloss: I'm finished washing clothes

sentence.source: Nickel, Marilyn; Wilner, John. Papers on Sranan Tongo. n.d. Summer Institute of Linguistics. Example 78b
sentence.text: langa a buku gi mi
sentence.gloss: hand me the book

sentence.source: Nickel, Marilyn; Wilner, John. Papers on Sranan Tongo. n.d. Summer Institute of Linguistics. Example 79b
sentence.text: a ben e rei wan moi krin oto
sentence.gloss: he was driving a nice clean car

sentence.source: Nickel, Marilyn; Wilner, John. Papers on Sranan Tongo. n.d. Summer Institute of Linguistics. Example 81
sentence.text: kande en srefi e kon na foto bori na agu gi mi
sentence.gloss: maybe he himself comes to the city to cook the pig for me

sentence.source: Nickel, Marilyn; Wilner, John. Papers on Sranan Tongo. n.d. Summer Institute of Linguistics. Example 82b
sentence.text: den srudati feti nanga densrefi
sentence.gloss: the soldiers fought with each other

sentence.source: Nickel, Marilyn; Wilner, John. Papers on Sranan Tongo. n.d. Summer Institute of Linguistics. Example 83b
sentence.text: te mi kisi a moni fu yu dan mi e go gi yu baka
sentence.gloss: if 1 get the money from you then I'll give it back

sentence.source: Nickel, Marilyn; Wilner, John. Papers on Sranan Tongo. n.d. Summer Institute of Linguistics. Example 84b
sentence.text: na Ontiman ben e sidon
sentence.gloss: Hunter was sitting (a new character introduced)
